intro: Quivisia sieberi, commonly known as the Sieber's quivisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
